DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the preventive effect of electroacupuncture and sham acupuncture on acute chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting and then investigate its potential mechanism by using functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI).
DOC.brief_title: The Effect and Mechanism of Electroacupuncture on Acute Chemotherapy-induced Nausea and Vomiting
DOC.criteria: First diagnosed stage ⅢⅣ lung cancer patients on cisplatin chemotherapy; Righthanded and aged 18 to 75 years; Karnosky performance status (KPS) ≥ 70; Life expectancy ≥ 6 months. Had brain metastases or other concurrent lifethreatening diseases; Nausea and/or vomiting were present 24h before chemotherapy treatment; Suffered from or had a history of gastrointestinal diseases; Had a history of head trauma, serious neurological or psychiatric disorders; Participating in other clinical trials currently; Had any contraindication to exposure to a high magnetic field or receive acupuncture
